summary: Request to create an ESLint plugin for the TypeScript SDK to catch determinism violations and other workflow-specific issues at compile time. The plugin would enforce workflow constraints like banned Node globals, proper async handling in signal handlers, and error throwing patterns.
userImpact: Users would be able to catch workflow determinism violations and other common mistakes at compile time rather than runtime, improving development experience and code quality.
proposedFix: Create @temporalio/eslint-plugin with rules for detecting banned Node globals in workflows, async code in signal handlers, and improper error throwing patterns. Configuration would use src/workflows/.eslintrc.json with plugin:@temporalio/recommended preset.
workaround: Currently users can use ESLint's no-restricted-imports rule as shown in temporalio/samples-typescript to prevent some issues, or manually review code for determinism violations.
keyQuote: we will probably make an eslint rule eventually but ultimately we are limited by what we can do with static analysis - cant query a module to see if it uses one of the banned Node globals.
